author: Doug Bostrom
content:
The mixed-bag update:

African Americans comprise about 13% of the U.S. population, but roughly 8.1% of Naval officers are Black, according to a 2019 report by the Congressional Research Service. Graduating from the Naval Academy is a prestigious honor, but fewer than 6% of the Naval Academy class is African American. — Black History – A Sailorâ€™s Perspective

At 78 years out, this seems a little too logarithmic in pace.

Progress, but it seems as though we could certainly pick up the pace.
